headline: Judy's Strawberry Pretzel Salad
description: This three-layer salad includes a pretzel crust, cream cheese center, and strawberry top.

video.description: This strawberry pretzel salad recipe features the unlikely combination of crispy pretzels, creamy cheesecake, and strawberry jello. Skeptical? In this video, Annie shares her honest reaction to the salty-sweet dessert and shows you how to make it.
video.name: We Tried Strawberry Pretzel Salad | Three-Layer Summer Dessert

name: Judy's Strawberry Pretzel Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Mix together the pretzels, 4 1/2 tablespoons sugar and melted butter. Press into the bottom of a 9x13 inch pan. Bake for 10 minutes, or until lightly toasted. Set aside to cool completely.
In a medium bowl, beat the sugar and cream cheese until smooth. Fold in whipped topping. Spread evenly over the cooled crust. Refrigerate until set, about 30 minutes.

In a medium bowl, stir together the gelatin mix and boiling water. Mix in frozen strawberries, and stir until thawed. Pour over cream cheese mixture in pan. Refrigerate until completely chilled, at least 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: My Mom used to serve this "salad" at holiday gatherings back in the 70s, so I wanted to honor her at our Christmas celebration this year. The sugar looked like a lot, so I cut it back by 20%. It was still pretty sweet. My children did not understand why it is called a "salad"; they thought it was much more of a dessert. I was happy to share the essence of one of my early childhood foods. Next time, I may cut the sugar even further. All in all, a delicious walk down memory lane.
I've been making this recipe for years and it remains a solid family favorite!

Notes: - double amount of pretzel crust - be sure sugar completely dissolved in butter before combining with pretzels - bake crust no more than 10 min - chill jello only for 10-20 min before pouring into pan or it will start to congeal. - Double Jello to keep in proportion with cream cheese layer - Strawberry syrup idea was good: for each box of Jello, use 1 cup BOILING water, stirring while on stovetop if necessary to fully dissolve mix (or it will be gritty and congeal too quickly), and 3/4 cup strawberry syrup - fewer strawberries (0.5-0.75 lb) was better than full pound. This will fill a 9”x13” casserole dish, and recipe can be halved if desired. Was delicious!!

I have been making this salad for years. I got it from my friend…curiously so…Judy! I absolutely agree with the step of cooling the jello mixture before pouring over the cream cheese layer. We t keeps the cream cheese from melting and breaking off into the jello topping. I also use the boiling water. The only difference in our recipe is that we add one tuna sized can of drained crushed pineapple to the cream cheese mixture. Absolutely delicious! I haven’t met anyone who doesn’t love this! It goes with dinner or as dessert!

This has always been a family favorite only we make it with raspberry jello and frozen raspberries. The years have sped by and now my son makes it for all festive family gatherings. In our family it’s “Red Raspberry Salad “.

This recipe is amazing. The salty sweet is so good. I had a craving for this and bought 2.5 lbs of fresh strawberries. I hulled them and cut the berries in quarters. I weighed out 16 ounces of cut strawberries. I put those a bowl. I then took some and pureed them in my blender. I used a cup of those pureed berries and used that for the cup of cold water to make the jello. I saw several people wondered if you could use fresh berries and i was able to.. There was about a cup of pureed berries left over. I used that to pour over the cut portions of this (dessert?).
Very easy! I made with mixed berries.
I've made this twice with a graham cracker crust. Yummy!

This was a perfect dessert. Sweet and salty. Made the crust the day before then put in frig. I used1.5 pkg cream cheese as opposed to 2. I used double the amount of frozen strawberries and it set my jello up perfectly to smooth over the cream cheese mixture. This will be my go to dessert year round
Rarely am I impressed by a jello recipe but this one is worth making. Crazy good!!!

This recipe is great!! Took it to a potluck & came home with an empty pan! I doubled the recipe, which was super easy to do. The only difference was I used fresh strawberries, rather than frozen and, rather than "floating" them in the jell-o, I placed them on the top of the cream cheese/whipped topping layer. Then, after waiting for the jell-o to cool and thicken slightly, I poured that gently over the top. It was a HIT!!! I will DEF make this my "Go To" for summertime potlucks!!!

I made this recipe exactly as written, and it tasted amazing! The only thing I will change is that I will use 2 cups of crushed pretzels next time because my crust layer was a little thin and the cooled butter was very obvious which was a little off-putting.
Made it for the 4th of July. Made the pretzel crust a little thicker. It was a hit. Thou pre cut they was taking 2 and 3 pieces. Thanks
Simply amazing!! A crowd favorite!! Adding this to my special holiday menus!

Easy + Big Hit = Great recipe
Like other tips say; double the Jell-O mix (keep the same amount of water) and mix in 1/2 teaspoon clear vanilla into the cream cheese layer. p.s. You can also use fresh strawberries.

Love this recipe. I do not use the frozen strawberries, I make the crust the night before and use less whip cream for a stiffer cream cheese filling. Allow the jello to set in the fridge for about an hour and then pour on top of the cream cheese filling. I prefer to put the pretzel cream cheese layer in the freezer while the jello is setting up in the fridge.

I’ve been making this for decades. It’s always a hit. I use pineapple juice instead of water for the jello. It gives the jello a lift.
The flavors are a wonderful blend of sweet, salty and cooling.
Absolutely delicious! Clear directions and easy to follow. I cooked the crust 10 minutes and may do 9 minutes next time. It was stuck to bottom of the pan the first day.
It was easy and delicious. Brought it to a potluck, and there were no leftovers.

I made this and it’s always a hit. I used fresh strawberries so I let the jello cool to room temp before adding the berries. I just love this for summer and since there are no nuts I feel comfortable taking it to a pot luck dinner.
Took this to a Memorial Day BBQ and everyone LOVED it. The only thing I changed was I used fresh strawberries instead of frozen.
Delish and beautiful! I took advice and doubled Jello layer and did not overcook pretzel crust.
Everyone always love this, and at family gatherings, I have to atleast double this recipe. My mom always makes me make it for her for any half special occasion- haha.. Can't get enough!

This turned out perfect. I made the pretzel bottom and let it cool in the refrigerator until completely cold and left the middle layer overnight. In the morning I pressed the cut strawberries into the middle layer. *Note: The strawberries cut neater when they are still frozen, just thawed enough to run a knife thru* finally I poured the very cooled jello onto it and put it in the fridge. The layers were neat and defined. I made a second batch with crushed pineapple mixed into the middle layer and into the jello, just make sure the pineapple is well drained.

This is a fabulous dessert . . . or is it a salad . . . you decide! I found that the trick to making the crust stay a bit fresher after it is once cut and the leftovers need to be stored is to not cover it! It makes a huge difference and although it is not quite the same as the day it is first eaten, it is not bad!
Perfection. Just don’t try with readi whip
Surprisingly good. I was worried about the pretzel but it works!
Love it!! Don’t bake a second longer than 10 minutes or you’ll have to chisel it from the pan. So delicious. Great blend of flavors. Thx!
Such a easy dessert, everyone I’ve served this too, loves it. Great recipe
My family loves this recipe!!
I made this & my family LOVED it! When strawberries are in season, I use fresh strawberries instead of frozen. I tried it with raspberry gelatin & fresh raspberries & it was equally delicious!

This is a holiday favorite in my family! We always make about 1.5X’s the amount of crust or it’s difficult to spread it all the way around the bottom of a 9x13” pan. Using a glass to press it down helps. Be sure to seal the cream cheese layer all the way around the dish or the jello will leak into the crust. Cool the jello before adding. Side note: We’re always careful to call this a salad as the title suggests even though it’s jam packed with sugar. Family joke.
This has become my youngest daughter's favorite dessert to make for gatherings
I made this twice and I’m so addicted!! I only make this for holidays.
Excellent! I make the recipe as listed and it is always a hit!
Just plain YUM!

Sooooo good! Six stars!! This was not 16 servings it was only 9, we ate the whole pan in one night, even though I baked it for 15 minutes and the crust was a little hard to get out. Don't worry the crust will harden even if it doesn't look done at ten minutes. But the taste was definitely worth the chiseling out of the pan, and I will so be making this again!! Thank you so much!
Always a crowd pleaser. I'm working on a healthier version.

I have made this many times & everyone loves it! It is a bit time consuming but we'll worth it!
Thanks Judy!
Delicious. Will take some of the suggestions into account next time like chilling the jello. I only had 1/2 cup of sugar and the cream cheese cool whip filling was plenty sweet enough. Great dessert.

This recipe was really easy and very delicious however the frozen strawberries in it made the Jell-O firm up too quickly so I had to boil the Jell-O in order for the strawberries to unfreeze and then I had to re-refrigerate so that process took a while. Next time I will boil the strawberries and water and then put in the Jell-O mix

This has been one of my all time favorites for years! The only thing is it doesn't keep well. Pretzel crust is good but gets soggy too fast!!! So living alone I decided to cut it in 1/2 and use an Oreo crust. And use a pie dish. The results were amazing. I still like the pretzel crust if I were to take it somewhere!
This childhood favorite is 5-star recipe that brings smiles to all. Fun to make and even better to eat. This is a very sweat treat for a hot summer day. I absolutely love having this in my cookbook.
wow, I am new to cooking and this turned out amazing! I am in love!
The crust especially is very good.
This is a crowd pleaser !!!!!

I had a desire for Strawberry Pretzel Salad. This was one of the best. I can't think of a thing I would change
.
This is an amazing mix of flavors that just works so well together. The only change I make is to use gluten free pretzels to make this dish gluten free.
Love it! I just broke the pretzels up a little instead of crushing. Probably don’t need as much butter if you do that.

My mom always made this for me when I was a kid. It was nice seeing this on here and I was able to make it! The only thing I do differently is instead of using normal pretzels, I use the pretzel thins.
I’ll certainly make it again as described in the recipe
I've been using this recipe for years. Everyone loves it. The only change I make is to use gluten-free pretzels because I have family members with Celiac Disease.
I made it and my family loved it. I Love to try out different recipes And this one was a family favorite. So easy to make and came out just as the recipe said. Will make it again for sure .
This dessert is very delicious and short easy to prepare. Always a crowd pleaser!
I had lost this Recipe years ago. Made it for a church lunch everyone loved it. Glad to have it back in my recipes.
Took it to a meeting to share, lots of compliments, and no left-overs!!
It was really good, but the bottom layer was too thin. Then again I didn't measure the pretzels after I crushed them.

I love this dessert! It’s so tasty! The combination of crunchy salty crust, creamy sweet cream cheese and tart strawberries is delicious. I usually add another 1/2 cup or so of pretzels and a bit more butter/sugar for the crust as I’ve found that 1 1/2 cups doesn’t seem to be enough for a 9x13” pan.
Didn’t change a thing!! This recipe is perfect!!

I made this for a Christmas luncheon and everyone loved it. I followed some suggestions from other reviewers (added brown sugar to crust, let the cheesecake set completely before adding jell-o, etc.) and it came out perfect and was easy to make. 
Thanks for sharing this recipe!
AWESOME!

This is one of those old standards that you make in the summer time for pool parties and summer gatherings. I made this as a light dessert for Thanksgiving and it went quickly. It was the first one to go.
I used sliced frozen strawberries instead of whole ones and my family loved it. I took it to the family picnic and they requested it for next years. Loved it.

My family couldn't get enough!!! 
Definitely a new holiday tradition!!!!
Thank you!!!
What a perfect combination of flavors!

I remember once that before I made this with this recipe,my mom actually made the same thing,it was delicious!But I,unfortunately,hate the combination of pretzels and sweet things,but it was still good.What I’m saying is that even though the pretzel part isn’t my favorite thing ever,but it is still a all time favorite!
Everyone loves this. I cut the recipe in half and it turned out great. I also let the jello set up some before pouring onto the cream cheese layer. Simple recipe.

It tasted really good, but I had the soggy-pretzel problem that some others mentioned. Next time, I’ll definitely do some tweaking. Also, I used sliced frozen strawberries like some others mentioned in the comments as well!
We love this salad. It is almost rich enough to be a dessert!
I made this for a July 4th party. It was the first thing gone. I added blueberries to the top with the strawberries. I had a bit of a time restraint so I made the jello the quick way too.
I put pecans in the pretzel crust so I like my recipe better
Turned out perfect!! Delicious!!!
Great recipe!!!! My man’s Mom used to make this but with a graham cracker crust, I like the pretzel crust. So delicious. Thanks for posting this recipe
In June, pick fresh strawberries, cut meaure & freeze. Then for each holiday, pull out a bag and place in hot jello mixture. Perfect summer treat for Thanksgiving, Christmas & Easter!
This salad is amazing. It was perfect just as written. Thanks for a great recipe!
Made it as written. Turns out wonderful every time.
This version was too sweet for my family. Next time I will half the cream cheese and double the entire jello layer. It also works better to use sliced strawberries.
Loved it and so did all of my family. Will be making this a lot.
the best
I make this often and never lasts the day! Similar to cheesecake but lighter.

Absolutely loved this! Unfortunately I followed the suggestion of another user and doubled the jello portion to equal the cream cheese portion...that was a mistake. It was way too much jello. Next time I’ll follow the recipe. Also, I used raspberry jello and frozen raspberries and the flavor was really REALLY good!!!!!
Made it by the recipe except for one thing I let the Jell-O set up for 25 minutes before putting on top of the cream cheese turned out great it was amazing
Made it straight from the recipe and it was perfect

I loved it! I was confused on the 16 oz frozen strawberries. I bought literally just that but then I had to slice up the strawberries once they thawed in the jello. So was I suppose to buy the sliced strawberries with sugar in a tub instead of literally just strawberries that are frozen?And I only had 1/3 less fat cream cheese on hand but will not be using that again. It turned out a little runny...so the presentation wasn’t the best. So I hope someone learns from my mistake.
I have made this for several family pot-luck get-togethers and everyone loves it so much that it's the first thing they ask me to bring to the next one!
I followed the recipe this time as I do with most new recipes. This is my first time making it, but hopefully not my last!
Refreshing, perfect mix of sweet and salty
Good, but makes a skimpy, too thin, 13 x 9 pan. Up ingredient volumes by another 1/2 of original measurement, or make in 9 x 9 pan.

I have made this several times, and it has always been a huge hit. I followed the recipe the first couple of time, but then I tried fresh berries on top instead of the jello mixture. It is still 5 stars as the recipe is written, but I much prefer it using fresh berries instead.

I made this today, using gluten-free pretzels for the crust. It came out really good! The only thing I might do different is use two packages of jello and 1 package of cream cheese, just to balance proportions a little more evenly. Taste is delicious though, spot on! Thanks Tom!
Went to a gathering and there were two other of the dish, but this one was the best!

Love this dish! I make it every Christmas. The sweet and salty combination is perfect as a side or dessert! Cutting and serving is the hard part, make sure you have a good knife and a flat metal spatula.
I made this for Christmas dinner. Everyone loved it. The only thing I did differently was to double the jello but I used the same amount of sliced strawberries. I have been asked to make it again.
Good to the last bite!

This is absolutely delicious and a new holiday staple! I didn’t add anything to the recipe, but read some of the other reviews. I’m thinking about doubling the amount of jello next time, but it’s really perfect as is.
Half recipe. Extra pretzels. 12 oz mixed berries
Very good. Recommend putting in a couple more crushed pretzels if the pretzel sugar butter mixture looks too buttery. That happened to us when we made it.
My families favorite!!
